description.narrative: More parents, teachers, adolescents and other stakeholders have increased knowledge and skills to eliminate harmful practices and better protect children from violence, exploitation and grave violations, which contributes to Access To Justice, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022 more children, especially the most vulnerable, are better protected from violence, exploitation and grave violations

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Ending violence against women and girls
MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

title.narrative: Occupied Palestinian Territ. Country Programme Action Plan
State of Palestine United Nations Development Assistance Framework
State of Palestine Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Programmes in State of Palestine (Child Protection)
"Palestinian children and women in Jordan Lebanon the Syrian Arab Republic and the State of Palestine Area Programme Document 2018-2022"
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 State of Palestine: Evaluation of Family Centres in Gaza
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

document-link.url: https://open.unicef.org/sites/transparency/files/documents/Palestine, State of Country Office Tender Notice.pdf

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More parents, teachers, adolescents and other stakeholders have increased knowledge and skills to eliminate harmful practices and better protect children from violence, exploitation and grave violations

description.narrative: Progress was made in reaching consensus on a national intersectoral strategy to reduce Violence Against Children in households, schools and communities. Grave violations affecting 15,838 children were documented and data on grave violations was utilized to inform programming and advocacy. UNICEF supported training of more than 3,000 adolescents on problem solving and communication skills and non-violence initiatives; and 3,500 caregivers and parents in positive discipline. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

baseline.value: No child friendly procedures for justice actors

actual.value: 2019:SOPs were developed for children in conflict with the law in Gaza, but lacked ownership by all stakeholders and was not applied in WB.

title.narrative: Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation

actual.value: 2019:National Children's Council convened once in 2019, but limited progress has been made on its scope and mandate. The MoSD has prioritized this with the DG for Children and Family affairs leading this process

title.narrative: Number of individuals in programme areas who regularly participate in dialogues promoting gender equitable norms including delaying child marriage

target.value: 2019:10,000 children reached with messaging around violence reduction and reduction in child marriages

actual.value: 2019:2,328 caregivers (76% females) reached with messaging around reduction in child marriage. Results were lower than anticipated given late receipt of funding and priority to reach children.

title.narrative: Country has a national, multi-sectoral plan(s) or strategy(ies) for coordinated action to prevent and respond to violence against children that meets key criteria for quality, according to status of plan.

actual.value: 2019:Draft National VAC strategy was developed in 2019. Document is in final stages of endorsement by government. Plans are to launch in 2020

title.narrative: Number of parents, teachers and adolescents reached with violence reduction activities
